definition: to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: I loafe and invite my soul, I lean and loafe at my ease observing a spear of summer grass.
sentences.chinese: 我流浪，並邀約我的靈魂，悠然俯看一片夏天的草葉。

sentences.english: Begeristain has there been made an offer that 'cannot be refused'.
sentences.chinese: 貝吉里斯坦已經收到一份“不可拒絕”的邀約。

sentences.english: Women wearing the color red were also more likely to receive a prom invitation and be treated to a more expensive date or night out.
sentences.chinese: 着紅裝的女性也因此更易收到舞會或燭光晚餐的邀約。

sentences.english: Accept an invitation you wouldn't normally.
sentences.chinese: 接受一個你一般不會接受的邀約。

sentences.english: Even the most interesting game should not keep you from going out with the family or friends.
sentences.chinese: 遊戲再好玩，你也不該無視家人或朋友的邀約。

sentences.english: But it is hard to see who might want to take up Mr Henderson's offer just now.
sentences.chinese: 可現在還看不出有誰想接受漢德森的邀約。

sentences.english: He even used the site to ask out a girl.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至還在站點上邀約女孩子。

definition: to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to get in touch with/to contact/to stay in contact (with)/liaison/(math.) connection
to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
connection/contact/relation/to get in touch with/to integrate/to link/to touch
cast and crew/performers and production team
